alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 2:38PM EDT until July 04 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN BELKNAP AND SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL COUNTIES... At 238 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain fell across the warned area earlier this afternoon. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell. Small streams and brooks have responded and are running high. Though the rain has moved out of the area, flooding is still possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ossipee, Moultonborough, Alton, Effingham, Wolfeboro, Brookfield, Tuftonboro, Wakefield and New Durham. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
